maml:description.maml:para: Extract the contents of a provisioning package.
Extract the contents of a provisioning package to the specified folder.
The Export-ProvisioningPackage cmdlet is supported on Windows 11 client operating system only.
Specifies the path to the output directory.
Indicates that the cmdlet exports contents even if there's an existing instance.
Indicates that the cmdlet only exports the Windows provisioning answer file.
Indicates that the provisioning package uses a connected device.
Specifies a path to store logs files resulting from the export operation.
Specifies the ID of the Package to be extracted.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.
Specifies the path to the package to be extracted.
Specifies the path to the output directory.
Indicates that the cmdlet exports contents even if there's an existing instance.
Indicates that the cmdlet only exports the Windows provisioning answer file.
Indicates that the provisioning package uses a connected device.
Specifies a path to store logs files resulting from the export operation.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.
Specifies a runtime provisioning package metadata object.
Specifies the path to the output directory.
Indicates that the cmdlet exports contents even if there's an existing instance.
Indicates that the cmdlet only exports the Windows provisioning answer file.
Indicates that the provisioning package uses a connected device.
Specifies a path to store logs files resulting from the export operation.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.
Indicates that the cmdlet exports contents even if there's an existing instance.
Indicates that the cmdlet only exports the Windows provisioning answer file.
Indicates that the provisioning package uses a connected device.
Specifies a path to store logs files resulting from the export operation.
Specifies the path to the output directory.
Specifies the ID of the Package to be extracted.
Specifies the path to the package to be extracted.
Specifies a runtime provisioning package metadata object.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example extracts the content of a Package specifying it's PackageId to the specified folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports an event trace log file for provisioning.
Exports trace events from an event trace log ETL file.
Specifies the ETL file location.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Indicates that the cmdlet overwrites an existing exported log if one exists.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the ETL file location.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Indicates that the cmdlet overwrites an existing exported log if one exists.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Export trace events from an ETL file -------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exports trace events from a specified ETL file and saves the logs to the C:\ETL\Logs folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about the installed provisioning package.
The Get-ProvisioningPackage cmdlet gets information about the installed provisioning package.
The Get-ProvisioningPackage cmdlet is supported on Windows 11 client operating system only.
Gets all the installed packages information.
Gets the connected device information.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.
Specifies the Id of a package.
Gets the connected device information.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.
Specifies the package path.
Gets the connected device information.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.
Gets all the installed packages information.
Gets the connected device information.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the Id of a package.
Specifies the package path.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about the testppkg.ppkg provisioning package.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists all installed trusted provisioning certificates.
Lists all installed trusted provisioning certificates; use this cmdlet to get the certificate thumbprint to use with the `Uninstall-TrustedProvisioningCertificate` cmdlet.
The Get-TrustedProvisioningCertificate cmdlet is supported on Windows 11 client operating system only.
Specifies the thumbprint of the certificate to retrieve.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the thumbprint of the certificate to retrieve.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.

command:example.maml:title: - Example 1: List installed trusted provisioning certificates -
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-TrustedProvisioningCertificate
The operation completed successfully.
No certificates found in the trusted provisioners store

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists all installed trusted provisioning certificates.

maml:description.maml:para: Install .PPKG package onto the local machine.

This cmdlet is used to install .ppkg files that are generated and exported by the Windows Configuration Designer tool (https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/configuration/provisioning-packages/provisioning-install-icd).
The Install-ProvisioningPackage cmdlet is supported on Windows 11 client operating system only.
You can use this cmdlet to install a .ppkg file interactively or silently by specifying the -QuietInstall switch parameter.
The default is an interactive install.
Path to provisioning package
Install package to removable media.
Force the installation of the package.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Quietly installs the package without any customer interaction.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.
Install package to removable media.
Force the installation of the package.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Path to provisioning package
Quietly installs the package without any customer interaction.
Specifies the name of a WPR profile file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will install the mypackage.ppkg file silently without customer interaction.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a certificate to the Trusted Certificate Store.
Installs the specified certificate to the Trusted Certificate Store.
The Install-TrustedProvisioningCertificate cmdlet is supported on Windows 11 client operating system only.
Path to .CER file
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies whether, if certificate already exists, it will be overwritten.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
Path to .CER file
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies whether, if certificate already exists, it will be overwritten.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Installs the specified certificate as a trusted provisioning certificate.

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstalls .PPKG package from the local machine.
Unintalls .PPKG package based on package ID, path, metadata, or all packages.
The Uninstall-ProvisioningPackage cmdlet is supported on Windows 11 client operating system only.
Removes all installed packages.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
Specifies the ID of a package.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the package path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
Specifies a runtime provisioning package metadata object.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
Removes all installed packages.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the ID of a package.
Specifies the package path.
Specifies a runtime provisioning package metadata object.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
Removes a previously installed provisioning certificate.
Removes a previously installed provisioning certificate.
The Uninstall-TrustedProvisioningCertificate cmdlet is supported on Windows 11 client operating system only.
Specifies a certificate thumbprint.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
If enabled, specifies that the device type is mobile.
Specifies the logs directory path.
Specifies a certificate thumbprint.
Specifies the location of the WPR profile file.
